callForwarding.title: Call Forwarding
callForwarding.noPhoneMessage: You need a phone number to set up call forwarding
callForwarding.infoBanner: Forward calls from your personal phone to your AI agent. When someone calls your personal number, the call will be handled by your AI agent.
callForwarding.numberHint: This is the number you'll forward calls to
callForwarding.step1Description: Select your mobile carrier from the list below
callForwarding.step2Description: Open your phone's dialer and dial the forwarding code
callForwarding.step3Description: You'll hear a confirmation tone or receive a message
callForwarding.forwardAllHint: Dial this code to forward all incoming calls
callForwarding.deactivateHint: Dial this code to stop call forwarding
callForwarding.noAnswerHint: Forward calls only when you don't answer
callForwarding.busyHint: Forward calls only when your line is busy
callForwarding.needHelp: If these codes don't work, contact your carrier's customer service. Some plans may require additional features to enable call forwarding.
callForwarding.attNotes: AT&T codes work for most plans. If issues arise, dial *#21# to check forwarding status or call 611 for support.
callForwarding.verizonNotes: Verizon codes are standard. Wait for confirmation tone after dialing. Call *73 followed by call to confirm deactivation.
callForwarding.tmobileNotes: T-Mobile uses GSM standard codes. These work on most T-Mobile and T-Mobile MVNO plans.
callForwarding.sprintNotes: Sprint network codes (now part of T-Mobile). If you're on an older Sprint plan, these codes should still work.
callForwarding.uscellularNotes: US Cellular standard forwarding codes. Some regional variations may apply - contact customer service if needed.
callForwarding.cricketNotes: Cricket uses AT&T network. These codes are compatible with most Cricket Wireless plans.
callForwarding.metroNotes: Metro by T-Mobile uses T-Mobile network codes. Same GSM standard format.
callForwarding.boostNotes: Boost Mobile codes may vary by network. If using T-Mobile network, try T-Mobile codes instead.
callForwarding.visibleNotes: Visible uses Verizon network. Standard Verizon forwarding codes apply.
callForwarding.googlefiNotes: Google Fi uses GSM codes. These work when connected to T-Mobile or US Cellular networks.

messages.tmobileNotes: T-Mobile uses GSM standard codes. These work on most T-Mobile and T-Mobile MVNO plans.

messages.cricketNotes: Cricket uses AT&T network. These codes are compatible with most Cricket Wireless plans.
messages.metroNotes: Metro by T-Mobile uses T-Mobile network codes. Same GSM standard format.
messages.boostNotes: Boost Mobile codes may vary by network. If using T-Mobile network, try T-Mobile codes instead.
messages.visibleNotes: Visible uses Verizon network. Standard Verizon forwarding codes apply.
messages.googlefiNotes: Google Fi uses GSM codes. These work when connected to T-Mobile or US Cellular networks.
